title: Systematic Investment Plan (SIP): 5 Benefits Of Investing
text:
Published: Saturday, September 12, 2015, 11:25 [IST] Facebook Twitter Google+ Comments Mail 
Systematic Investment Plans (SIP) is a method of investing a fixed sum on regular pre-specified basis, in a mutual fund scheme. 
When investing a fixed sum, it allows you to buy units on a particular date each month, which will help in saving each month. By investing in SIP, individual will there by average out costs of investing and will benefit from the power of compounding. 
Individuals have the option to choose between quantity-based and amount based SIPs from Stocks, Mutual Funds, ETFs and Gold. Systematic Investment Plan (SIP): 5 Benefits of Investing 1/6 Investment with small amounts 
Under Systematic Investments Plans one can opt by investing in mutual funds with small sum each month of as low as Rs 1000. Systematic Investment Plan (SIP): 5 Benefits of Investing 2/6 2) Reduces Risk by Rupee cost averaging 
Most of the analysts or investor suggest to invest through the Systematic Investment Plan, as it gives you an opportunity to average your costs, since you cannot predict market movements. 
Systematic Investment Plan (SIP): 5 Benefits of Investing 3/6 3) Returns depend on Power of compounding 
By investing even small amount it is to accumulate wealth in long term. As investment and returns are mostly dependent on the power of compounding, it is better to start early to make higher returns. Systematic Investment Plan (SIP): 5 Benefits of Investing 4/6 Taxation on SIPs 
Investment in equity SIP will not attract any capital gains if held for more than one year. 
Systematic Investment Plan (SIP): 5 Benefits of Investing 5/6 5) Disciplined approach 
Individuals can diversify investments through multiple SIPs in different schemes to optimize returns as per your needs You might like
